ros2_intro.content: ROS2 is the next generation of the Robot Operating System. It provides a collection of libraries and tools to help software developers create robot applications. It offers improved security, better real-time support, and a more modular architecture compared to ROS1.

ros2_communication.content: ROS2 communication patterns include topics for asynchronous message passing, services for request-response interactions, and actions for long-running tasks with feedback. These patterns provide different ways for nodes to communicate based on their specific needs.

ros2_services.content: Services in ROS2 provide a request-response communication pattern. A service client sends a request to a service server, which processes the request and returns a response. This is useful for operations that require immediate results.

ros2_parameters.content: Parameters in ROS2 allow nodes to be configured at runtime. They provide a way to modify node behavior without recompiling code. Parameters can be set at launch time or changed dynamically during execution.

ros2_differences.content: ROS2 differs from ROS1 in several key ways: it uses DDS for communication instead of its own custom protocol, provides better security with authentication and encryption, has improved real-time support, and offers a more modular architecture that supports multiple DDS implementations.
